page.title: 01Ledbury
page.content: Ledbury is a charming town 14 miles east of Hereford. Many old buildings have been retained, including half timbered Tudor houses near the towns centre. There is also a 12c Parish church with a tower from the following century and which rises to 202 feet. In the High Street is a 17c market house standing on pillars and the 16c Feathers inn near the cross roads. The town sands on the Worcester Hereford railway line, and has its own station, the A449 runs through as a main road link. The surrounding area is well wooded, both deciduous and coniferous, and is important for its contribution to the cider industry.
